rules.description: Maven/Gradle could not find or resolve a dependency
rules.suggestion: Check the dependency coordinates (groupId, artifactId, version). Verify that the dependency exists in the configured repositories. Add the correct repository if using a non-Maven Central dependency.

rules.description: Conflicting versions of the same dependency
rules.suggestion: Use dependency management to enforce specific versions. In Maven, use <dependencyManagement> section to specify versions. In Gradle, use the resolution strategy or force specific versions.

rules.description: The Maven POM file has syntax errors or invalid structure
rules.suggestion: Check the XML syntax in your pom.xml file. Ensure all XML tags are properly closed and nested. Validate your POM against the XML schema if needed.

rules.description: Maven/Gradle couldn't find the specified plugin
rules.suggestion: Check the plugin coordinates (groupId, artifactId, version). Verify that the plugin repository is properly configured. For custom plugins, ensure the plugin repository is included.
Review the complete error log to identify the specific cause. Common issues include compilation errors, test failures, dependency problems, or plugin configuration issues.

rules.description: Java compilation error in Maven/Gradle build
rules.suggestion: Check the error message and fix the Java syntax or semantic issue. Common errors include undefined symbols, type errors, or visibility problems.
Check your build.gradle file for syntax errors or invalid configuration. Verify that all plugins and dependencies are properly declared.

rules.pattern: Gradle build daemon has been stopped
rules.description: The Gradle daemon crashed during the build
rules.suggestion: Check if the daemon ran out of memory. Increase Gradle daemon memory with org.gradle.jvmargs=-Xmx2g in gradle.properties. Try running with --no-daemon to isolate the issue.

rules.pattern: (?:Minimum required Gradle version|Gradle version ([\d\.]+) is required)
rules.description: The Gradle version is outdated for the project
rules.suggestion: Update your Gradle version to the required version. Update the Gradle wrapper with ./gradlew wrapper --gradle-version=X.Y.Z or update your system Gradle installation.

rules.description: Java class not found, likely due to a missing dependency
rules.suggestion: Identify the missing class and add the dependency that contains it to your pom.xml or build.gradle file. Use Maven Central or other repository searches to find the right dependency.

rules.description: Property or variable referenced in the build file not found
rules.suggestion: Define the missing property in your build file, settings file, or using -D flag for system properties. Check for typos in property references.

rules.pattern: (?:Module not found|project not found|Could not find the module)
rules.description: Referenced module in a multi-module project not found
rules.suggestion: Check the module path and name in your parent POM or settings.gradle file. Ensure the module directory exists and has a proper build file.
